meanings.definition: A circular object that revolves on an axle and is used for transportation.
meanings.sent1: The wiels of the bicycle spun smoothly as he pedaled.
meanings.sent2: The wiels of the car helped it move forward.
meanings.sent3: The wiels on the bus went round and round, taking people to their destinations.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts turned like the wiels of a clock, always in motion.
meanings.sent5: The wiels of the train clacked rhythmically on the tracks.

meanings.definition: To turn rapidly in a circular motion.
meanings.sent1: She wiels around in excitement when she hears good news.
meanings.sent2: The dancer wiels gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent3: The cat wiels playfully after its tail, trying to catch it.
meanings.sent4: Time wiels forward, never stopping for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The wind wiels through the trees, rustling the leaves.

meanings.sent2: The odometer in the car has a wiels that tracks mileage.
